Welcome to The World

Itâ€™s a floating city exclusively home to the 1%, a playground for multimillionaires and billionaires that circumnavigates the worldâ€™s oceans. Welcome to The World, an exclusive private residential ship home to 165 superluxe apartments. This vessel is shrouded in secrecy and buying a condo on board is an invite-only situation â€“ youâ€™ve got to be nominated by one resident and seconded by another. A net worth of a cool $10 million is said to be compulsory. If youâ€™re imagining decadent parties, filled with intrigue and free-flowing champagne â€“ essentially a maritime episode of the HBO series â€œThe White Lotusâ€ â€“ youâ€™re perhaps not far off, at least according to one ex-passengerâ€™s account. â€œIâ€™m not saying that everything that happened on â€˜The White Lotusâ€™ has happened on The World, but I think, in large measure, the comparison is not inaccurate,â€ former resident Peter Antonucci tells CNN Travel. â€œThere are a lot of wealthy people doing playful things, sometimes naughty things, sometimes scandalous things.â€ Antonucci is a retired lawyer who spent six years as a resident of The World. In 2019, he sold up. His reasoning? â€œOnce youâ€™ve circumnavigated the globe a few times, youâ€™ve seen it. I had seen what I wanted to see, I was ready to do something new.â€ Back on dry land, Antonucci started going through the journals heâ€™d kept during his years on board and decided the â€œcountry club meets sorority houseâ€ vibe was the perfect inspiration for fiction. Antonucciâ€™s since written three novels set on a fictional ship, the most recent of which, â€œTides of Betrayal,â€ promises â€œsecrets, sins, and scandalsâ€ on the high seas.
